There's a curious reason I can't stop listening to Aberfeldy.

Their band name starts with an A. Even worse, it's followed by a B. This pretty much means it's at the top of my iTunes library, and I'm a sucker for suggestion. Somewhere to Jump From</em> was probably one of my favourite releases last year. Combined with ALWAYS seeing it when I loaded my library, it's a must for plays.

Don't get me wrong though, Aberfeldy do deserve it. They're unabashedly twee and folky, but squeeze in a lot of catchy synth riffs as well. Riley Briggs is an extremely skilled songwriter, the lyrics are clever and unusual - If I were a Joiner </em>sings about using your natural talents to make dedications towards your lover. If singers sing about their lovers, what on earth would someone else do?

If I were a joiner, you know what I'd do?
I'd put up a shelf
A shelf all about you</blockquote>
[mp3j track="Aberfeldy - If I Were a Joiner@http://www.burythehammer.com/music/05%20If%20I%20Were%20a%20Joiner.mp3"]
